ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I deepened my knowledge of grammar from SPAN 110. I also improved my listening and speaking skills, but not as much as I had hoped compared to SPAN 110.
I learned about relevant cultural information about 5 different Spanish-speaking countries that will help me in my planned major of ER&M.
Basic Spanish, at the second level.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It could be improved by removing the readings that were not tested on and seemed like fillers. I was confused about the point of watching Al Otro Lado, I thought it was very pointless and a waste of time. I wish we could have spent those class days reviewing for the final test which was significantly harder than anything else we did in that class.

Strengths: 1. The textbook was very useful for learning grammar and having a source of reference. 2. I thought the presentations were a good way to learn about Spanish or Latin American culture, while also improving our speaking skills. Weaknesses: 1. Class time could have been been spent doing more useful activities. We didn't spend much time talking, which I think is a major purpose of class to improve our speaking and listening skills. 2. The absence policy was unfair. Although we are allowed 5 absences throughout the semester, this is pretty deceiving as on some days we have small assignments which need to be submitted in class or else we don't receive any credit. I thought this was especially unfair. 3. Supersite activities were not very helpful in improving grammar. I also did not think Palabras Problematicas were very useful.
Better professors across the board. I thought my instructor was not as skillful as the others.
Teacher was not engaged whatsoever. Course schedule was easy to keep up with. Hard to learn when teacher did not seem like she wanted to be there.
Too much reading, not enough teaching grammar.
It is too hard. Not designed as a true intro class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It was a good class to fulfill the language requirement.
I would not recommend this course. I enjoy Spanish, but think the organization of the class was not very fair and conducive to learning the language.
No, I didn't enjoy it. Would only recommend if said student had strong interest in Spanish or had to fulfill a requirement.
Yes, learning Spanish is a very practical skill to have right now and especially within the next century.
Only if they need the credit or it is their major.
No, unless you took spanish in high school.
